basics.name: Bo Yang
basics.summary:
Hello! I am a recent graduate of Georgia Tech's Computer Science Master's program. I am looking for opportunities in software engineering and machine learning. 

 My interests are distributed systems, pruning neural network architectures, and programming in Rust. Feel free to check out my projects and read about my OMSCS experience in the blog linked below. 

 I currently work as a structural engineer in bridge inspection and design.

work.name: Ingenimax
work.summary: Contributed to platform engineering AI agent development for automated Kubernetes and AWS container deployment.
highlights: Contributed to the code base for a platform engineering AI agent that deployed Kubernetes and AWS containers based on client needs
responsibilities: Developed and tested AI agent capabilities for automated infrastructure deployment
Implemented LLM query and chain of thought functionalities
Tested context fetching and integration with cloud platforms
achievements: Successfully implemented and tested core AI agent features for automated deployment

work.name: South Col Engineering, P.C.
work.summary: Conduct bridge inspections and structural analysis for NYSDOT, processing field data and compiling inspection reports.
highlights: Conducted inspections of in-service bridges in New York State Region 8 for NYSDOT
responsibilities: Performed structural inspections of in-service bridges as subcontractor to WSP
Processed field data and performed structural loss calculations
Compiled inspection reports in NYSDOT's Bridge Data Information System
achievements: Successfully completed numerous bridge inspection projects maintaining high quality standards

projects.name: Bridge Database Management App
description: A full-stack Flask application integrating a fine-tuned T5-Small transformer model for natural language querying of infrastructure data
Features automated deployment via Azure App Service and Fly.io with CI/CD
Includes MLflow for experiment tracking and Pydantic for type-safe configuration

projects.name: Lighweight Spark
description: A simplified Spark framework built in Rust

projects.name: Lightweight Convolutional Neural Network
projects.description: Developed a distributed solver using PyTorch and Hugging Face Accelerate for parallel model training on GaTech's HPC cluster.
highlights: Implemented pruning methodology achieving up to 52% parameter reduction on DenseNet121
Maintained high model accuracy on CIFAR-10 and ImageNet datasets
Utilized structured and unstructured pruning techniques
